txt.en: Instance: Confronting Dravron
'Not for much longer by the looks of it.'
'I think not.'
'Hah! Look at him sweat.'
'and as for you, Dornach. Nathiel...'
'Thought he had the perfect scheme going!'
'...I will teach you the price of your insolence.'
'But you got greedy, didn't you Dravron? You cheat!'
'Enough! I am master of this land!'
'Oh will you now?'
'I need heed no one's word but my own!'
'Yes. By law you must record any sales you make as well as receipts for any due taxes.'
'You will respect my father in my presence, Dravron.'
'And give you time to falsify your records?'
'Peace, my lord. I am Dornach. I am something of a leader for the workers here.'
'And the business I conduct is on behalf of all Gondor.'
'I will have them now, Dravron. It is my right to demand them.'
'Not these brigands that Dravron brought in to mind us...'
'The entire kingdom suffers.'
'My patience wears thin.'
'Greetings, little lordling! Are you here to conduct business on behalf of your doddering old father?'
'...but good folk who wish to do their part to see Gondor renewed.'
'Many have lost their homes.'
'You would threaten citizens of Gondor?'
'Which is my right, per the agreement your family made with mine generations ago.'
'Yet you sit on the lumber that could be used to rebuild those homes.'
'As Lord of the Vale I cannot stand idly by.'
'My... ledgers?'
'Damn... you.'
'Indeed. I have verified your claim for myself.'
'You will surrender yourself.'
'Aha, of course. I will have them brought to you...'
'So I will not waste words appealing to your stone heart.'
'...by the end of the day.'
'On our left...'
'But as acting Lord of the Vale, it falls to me to enforce the laws of our land.'
'Why youâ€”'
'and our right...'
'And to that end... I would see your ledgers, Dravron.'
'Silence! You will regret that outburst! You work for ME!'
'Grrragh! Men! Escort the lordling off of MY land.'
'He will see my books when they are ready and not a moment sooner!'
'I commend you and your people for their bravery, Dornach.'
'Thank you all for your assistance.'
'I think we will have much to discuss in the coming days.'
